extendedInfo.description: CB WiFi is an application for Cincinnati Bell Wireless subscribers. This is a free service that gives CBW customers access to the worldâs largest network of Wi-Fi hotspots, including Cincinnati Bell's cbwifi network. CB WiFi automatically connects your phone to Wi-Fi and helps you save on mobile data usage. Once set-up, CB WiFi operates in the background to automatically connect to Wi-Fi hotspots. CB WiFi makes connecting to Wi-Fi network convenient and easy.

reviews.title: htc one s phone
reviews.comment: went to cbwifi and my bill went from $122.00 per month to $18.00 per month, with savings I could pay a few more bille  love it
reviews.author: Mark Barlow

reviews.title: Kills battery life
reviews.comment: I only had this installed for about a day and noticed it was destroying my battery life. I didn\'t have it long enough to know whether it actually works as advertised in terms of auto-connecting to open Wi-Fi connections, but even if it does work well for that, it\'s definitely not worth the tradeoff in battery life.
reviews.author: Robert Alonso

reviews.title: How it works
reviews.comment: After you download CB WiFi to a qualified Android phone, turn on WiFi on your phone and CB WiFi will connect your phone to all of the thousands of Wi-Fi hotspots included in the network.     A few examples of WiFi hotspot locations that CB WiFi will automatically log users into include Cincinnati Bell WiFi (cbwifi), HomeDepot, Staples, Panera, Wendy\342\200\231s, and Starbuck\342\200\231s (attwifi). CB WiFi will skip the step of having to agree to each hotspot\'s terms & conditions. Try going to a location like this to see how it works.

reviews.title: What does it do?
reviews.comment: I am a Cincinnati Bell customer, and I fail to see what this app does for me.  I have never seen one of their WiFi hotspots in the wild, nor has this app ever let me connect to this supposed \"world\342\200\231s largest network of Wi-Fi hotspots.\"  All paid public WiFi hotpots I\'ve encountered while using this app still want me to pay.   The data usage meter in this app is kind of informative.  Unfortunately, sometimes this app actually interferes with connecting to saved WiFi networks (like my home network), which actually results in me using  *more* cellular data, not less.   My phone is almost two years old and onboard storage space is tight, so I have uninstalled this app.  Maybe when I get a more modern phone I\'ll try it again.
reviews.author: Grant Stevens

reviews.title: Wonderful!
reviews.comment: This app helps so much, I don\'t have to worry about finding a wifi to connect to and I don\'t use as much data anymore
